"A.P.239/5/4": "Ah, it's you. I'm glad to see you again."
"I'm growing bored of looking at the surly expressions on the faces of Eu and that boy there."
"This planet is boring, too. Sand, sand and more sand, as far as the eye can see. What a desolate place."
"What was this planet called again, Lillipa? Hmm... I don't believe we ever ruled such a place."
"Hey, [Apprentice], cough up some answers already. What did you mean earlier when you said the [Profound Darkness] appeared \"again\"?"
"Firstly, it's not \"Apprentice\". My name is Aurora. Don't make that mistake again, Eu."
"And I think what I said was clear enough. You have heard that the [Profound Darkness] was born in the era of the Photoners, yes?"
"In fact, the [Profound Darkness] was our creation. And its birth caused us great difficulties."
"Nobody expected our experiments to produce such a result. But when it emerged, we worked tirelessly to come up with countermeasures that would let us seal it away."
"Even sealing it away is unimaginable to us. How did you do it?"
"Hm? Let me think... Ah, yes. I wasn't involved in it myself, you see..."
"But as I understand it, the [Profound Darkness] is the antithesis of Photons. It pursues and devours Photons wherever it finds them."
"And so, we channelled all of our Photons into a single person, and sealed them away. The [Profound Darkness] followed them into the seal."

"Forcing all your Photons into one person and sealing them away...
Are you sure that's what happened?"
"As I said, I wasn't personally involved, but an Admiral I was acquainted with told me all about it afterwards."
"...That's sick."
"Sick? How so? It might be a distasteful idea, but one person's sacrifice saved an entire universe."
"I'd think you'd understand our way of thinking a little better, Eu. As a former [Apprentice] host, and all."
"Me...? Yeah, I guess I understand you. When I was [Apprentice], I wouldn't have thought twice about doing something like that."
"But that doesn't stop me feeling angry about it now."
"...I was being manipulated. Not just my memories, my way of thinking too."

"...Well, our seal may have worked, but then the Dark Falz came along and destroyed our civilization anyway.
So much for our great victory."
"...You can say that again."

"I'm bored of this area.
Take me to another."
